Speaking of which, I just re-listened to @lingopod's episode on @GrammarTable. *This* is how to enjoy the English language 

https://t.co/PSgfLGBVCo

Sometimes this columnist points out uses of language in the media that are obfuscating or otherwise nefarious, which is very much worth doing. But there was little of that on display this week. A real waste when there is so much interesting stuff to say about language.

Oh yeah, because people think their peeves make them seem intelligent, and the Observer wants to give its readership room to feel smarter than other people. 

It's cheap and it's snobby.

Not going to QT the peeving that @ObserverUK published under the category 'linguistics' today, but why does a 'liberal' outlet pay for & promote content that is just "I don't like it when other people use language differently from how I do"?
